text: The content from IRM 25.18.3 dated March 4, 2011 is obsolete. This IRM is obsolesced because the information in this IRM has been incorporated into IRM 25.15.5, Relief from Community Property Laws, IRM 25.18.2, Income Reporting Considerations of Community Property, and IRM 25.18.4, Collection of Taxes in Community Property States, as reﬂected in the crosswalk below:
IRM 25.18.3.7, Relief Not Available if Fraudulent Scheme, Closing Agreement or Offer In Compro- mise
Revised and moved content to IRM 25.15.5.14.1, Traditional Relief.

From To IRM 25.18.3.14, Filing Requests for Relief Under IRM 25.15.5.15, Requesting Relief under IRC IRC 66 66(c). IRM 25.18.3.15, Time for Filing Requests for Relief IRM 25.18.3.15(1) moved to IRM 25.15.5.16, Time Under IRC 66 Period for Filing a Request for Relief. Content from IRM 25.18.3.15(2) was removed based on Rev. Proc. 2013-34. IRM 25.18.3.15(3) was revised and moved to IRM 25.15.5.20, Notiﬁcation Require- ment. IRM 25.18.3.16, Refunds Under IRC 66 Revised and moved content to IRM 25.15.5.22, Refunds Under IRC 66. IRM 25.18.3.17, Judicial Review of Denial of IRC Revised and moved content to IRM 25.15.5.21, 66 Relief Appeal Rights. Exhibit 25.18.3-1, IRC 66 Pro Forma Checksheets IRC 66 Pro Forma has been obsoleted. Pro forma and Workpapers for Examiners checksheets for IRC 66(a) and IRC 66(b) have been moved to Exhibit 25.18.2-1, IRC 66(a) and IRC 66(b) Pro Forma Checksheets for Examiners. Workpapers for IRC 66(c) are replaced with Job Aid, Relief from Community Property Laws/ Community Property States, IRC 66(c), which is available on the MySB/SE Innocent Spouse webpage.
IRM 25.18.3.17, Judicial Review of Denial of IRC 66 Relief
Revised and moved content to IRM 25.15.5.21, Appeal Rights.

EFFECT ON OTHER DOCUMENTS

IRM 25.18.3 dated March 4, 2011 is obsolete as of the date of this Manual Transmittal. Guidance related to cases involving taxpayers domiciled in community property states, or cases otherwise raising community property issues has been incorporated into IRM 25.15.5, Relief from Community Property Laws; IRM 25.18.2, Income Reporting Considerations of Community Property; and IRM 25.18.4, Collection of Taxes in Community Property States.
AUDIENCE
This IRM section is intended to address the needs of all Service employees who are working on cases taxpayers domiciled in community property states, or cases otherwise raising community
